CatDescriptText: Mrs. Irene Jones, 2-E Terrace, McKees Rocks, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A2, with question: "Do you think that Negroes display any racial prejudice towards each other?"   Answer reads: "Yes, I think so. I think that we discriminate against ourselves.  For instance, a lot of times if a person happens to be a mulatto, he seems to shy away from darker people.  In fact, sometimes he does not want to sit beside the other person."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Irene Jones wearing hat and coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
